caption:
Table 3. Evaluation of the sensitivity of PSC loss to data sampling. Hybrid-PSC with random PSC and Hybrid-PSC with CB-PSC denote in 
the PSC based hybrid network, we use random data sampling and class-balanced data sampling for the feature learning branch respectively. 
Classification accuracy (%) on long-tailed CIFAR-100 is reported.

Table 4. Evaluation of the advantage of supervised contrastive 
losses over cross-entropy loss for feature learning in long-tailed 
classification. CE-CE denotes both feature learning and classifier 
learning adopt cross-entropy loss, i.e., our supervised contrastive 
loss is replaced by cross-entropy loss. Classification accuracy (%) 
on long-tailed CIFAR-100 is reported.

Table 5. Evaluation of the advantage of the curriculum based joint 
training over two-stage training. Two-stage SC denotes we train 
the features and classifiers in separate stages. Hybrid-SC w/o 
curriculum means we use equal and fixed weighting for the feature 
and classifier learning during the training process. Classification 
accuracy (%) on long-tailed CIFAR-100 is reported.
